questions.solution: Solution:		The relative humidity is a measure of the air's actual water vapour content this statement is incorrect.

questions.Question: Without the atmospheric greenhouse effect, the average surface temperature would be:
questions.optionC: The same as it is now
questions.optionD: Much more variable than it is now
questions.solution: Solution:		Without this greenhouse effect, the average surface temperature would be 255 degrees kelvin (-18 degrees Celsius or 0 degrees Fahrenheit); a temperature so low that all water on Earth would freeze, the oceans would turn into ice and life, as we know it, would not exist.

questions.Question: How much radiant energy will an object emit if its temperature is at absolute zero?

questions.solution: Solution:		An object emit at absolute zero won't emit radiant energy.

questions.Question: A food web is

questions.solution: Solution:		A food web (or food cycle) is the natural interconnection of food chains and a graphical representation (usually an image) of what-eats-what in an ecological community. Another name for food web is consumer-resource system.

questions.Question: Which of the following is mainly responsible for the extinction of wild life
questions.solution: Solution:		All of these.

questions.Question: The percentage of water vapour present in the air compared to that required for saturation is the:
questions.solution: Solution:		Air with a 50 percent relative humidity actually contains one-half the amount of water vapor required for saturation. Air with a 100 percent relative humidity is said to be saturated because it is filled to capacity with water vapour.

questions.Question: Major cause of Ozone depletion is due to which chemical?
questions.solution: Solution:		Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and other halogenated ozone depleting substances (ODS) are mainly responsible for man-made chemical ozone depletion. The total amount of effective halogens (chlorine and bromine) in the stratosphere can be calculated and are known as the equivalent effective stratospheric chlorine (EESC).

questions.Question: Rain during November is more acidic than monsoon rain due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Rain during November is more acidic than monsoon rain due to dissolved SO2.

questions.Question: The formula for exponential population growth is
questions.solution: Solution:		The formula of exponential growth is dN/dt=rN where dN/dt is the rate of change in population size, r is the biotic potential and N is the population size.

questions.Question: The temperature scale that sets freezing of pure water at 32o F:
questions.solution: Solution:		Under this system, the Fahrenheit scale is redefined slightly so that the freezing point of water is exactly 32 °F, and the boiling point is exactly 212 °F or 180 degrees higher.

questions.Question: The pollutant that causes hole in the ozone layer is
questions.solution: Solution:		Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and other halogenated ozone depleting substances (ODS) are mainly responsible for man-made chemical ozone depletion. The total amount of effective halogens (chlorine and bromine) in the stratosphere can be calculated and are known as the equivalent effective stratospheric chlorine (EESC).

questions.Question: Ozone depletion is mostly caused by
questions.solution: Solution:		Ozone depletion occurs when chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and halons—gases formerly found in aerosol spray cans and refrigerants—are released into the atmosphere.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is the correct percentage of the two green house gases that contribute to the total global warming?
questions.solution: Solution:		Methane-20%, N2O-18% is the correct percentage of the two green house gases that contribute to the total global warming.

questions.Question: Pick out the potent green house gas
questions.solution: Solution:		Methane (CH4) is the potent green house gas.

questions.Question: An ecosystem must have continuous external source of
questions.solution: Solution:		An ecosystem must have continuous external source of energy.

questions.Question: When number of food chains is interlocked this is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The interlocking pattern of various food chains is referred as food web.

questions.Question: Rain water harvesting is a major method implemented for_____________
questions.solution: Solution:		Rainwater harvesting has been a popular method of obtaining water for agriculture and for drinking purposes in rural homes. The legislation to promote rainwater harvesting was enacted through the Urban Development Authority (Amendment) Act, No. 36 of 2007.

questions.Question: The pyramid of numbers is inverted in the case of
questions.solution: Solution:		Pyramid of number indicates the number of individuals at each trophic level. The pyramid of number is inverted in tree ecosystem. In this, the the first trophic level contains least number of trees. The insects feeding on primary producer occupy second trophic level.

questions.Question: Burning of coal produces oxides of sulphur and nitrogen which combined with water vapor leads to
questions.solution: Solution:		Burning of coal produces oxides of sulphur and nitrogen which combined with water vapor leads to acid rain.

questions.Question: What is the official name of IUCN?

questions.solution: Solution:		The International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN; officially International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources) is an international organization working in the field of nature conservation and sustainable use of natural resources.

questions.Question: What is the most important factor for the success of animal population?
questions.solution: Solution:		The process by which a species becomes fit to its survival in the environment is called adaptability. When the environmental factors change the organism has to adapt to its surrounding by changing its temperature or metabolism over a period of time, Hence adaptability is the result of natural selection.

questions.Question: _________ is the element used to produce nuclear energy
questions.solution: Solution:		Uranium is the fuel most widely used to produce nuclear energy. That's because uranium atoms split apart relatively easily. Uranium is also a very common element, found in rocks all over the world.

questions.Question: Carbon dioxide is called greenhouse gas because it is
questions.optionA: Transparent to sunlight but traps heat
questions.optionB: Transparent to heat but traps sunlight
questions.optionC: Used in green-house to increase plant growth
questions.optionD: Transparent to both sunlight and heat
questions.solution: Solution:		Those gas molecules in the Earth's atmosphere with three or more atoms are called "greenhouse gases" because they can capture outgoing infrared energy from the Earth, thereby warming the planet. The greenhouse gases include water vapor with three atoms (H2O), ozone (O3), carbon dioxide (CO2), and methane (CH4).

questions.Question: Which of the following enhances soil fertility?
questions.solution: Solution:		Crop rotation enhances soil fertility.

questions.Question: All of the following are advantages of dams except

questions.solution: Solution:		Humidity is the measure of the amount of moisture in the air. A psychrometer is an example of a hygrometer. A psychrometer uses two thermometers to measure relative humidity; one measures the dry-bulb temperature and the other measures the wet-bulb temperature.

questions.Question: Freshwater protozoans react to a/an  __________ environment by removing water through _______
questions.solution: Solution:		Freshwater protozoans react to a/an hypotonicenvironment by removing water through a contractile vacuole.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the poorest conductor of heat?

questions.Question: Which latitude belt best describes the middle latitudes?
questions.solution: Solution:		The middle latitudes (also called the mid-latitudes, sometimes midlatitudes, or moderate latitudes) are a spatial region on Earth located between the latitudes 23°26'22" and 66°33'39" north, and 23°26'22" and 66°33'39" south.

questions.Question: At middle latitudes, the base of an altostratus or altocumulus cloud would generally be found between:
questions.solution: Solution:		At middle latitudes, the base of an altostratus or altocumulus cloud would generally be found between: 6,500 and 23,000 feet.

questions.Question: Percentage of forest area recommended by the the national forest policy for plains is
questions.solution: Solution:		From the given options, the closest option is 33% for plains and 67% for hills.However, there have been many reports that suggest that according to the National Forest Policy (1988), an overall of 33% of the total geographical area of a country should be under forest/tree cover with 66 percent in the hills and 20 percent in the plains.

questions.Question: Commonly used radioactive isotopes in scientific research
questions.solution: Solution:		Commonly used radioactive isotopes in scientific research 14 C, 125 I and 32 P.

questions.solution: Solution:		If water vapour comprises 3.5 percent of an air parcel whose total pressure is 1,000 mb, the water vapour pressure would be 35 mb.

questions.Question: In pond ecosystem, the pyramid of biomass is
questions.solution: Solution:		The pyramid of biomass may be "inverted". For example, in a pond ecosystem, the standing crop of phytoplankton, the major producers, at any given point will be lower than the mass of the heterotrophs, such as fish and insects.

questions.Question: In grassland ecosystem, the pyramid of biomass is
questions.solution: Solution:		In grassland ecosystem, the shape of pyramid of biomass is upright. In grassland ecosystem, the biomass at the base is maximum followed by that in primary consumers (herbivores), followed by that in secondary consumers (carnivores). The base of the pyramid of biomass represents the producers in a pond ecosystem.

questions.Question: If the air temperature increased, with no addition or removal of water vapour, the actual vapour pressure would:

questions.solution: Solution:		If the air temperature increased, with no addition or removal of water vapour, the actual vapour pressure would stay the same.

questions.Question: Superbugs are
questions.solution: Solution:		Superbugs are strains of bacteria that are resistant to several types of antibiotics. questions.Question: A small quantity of  __________ material can produce an enormous amount of energy
questions.solution: Solution:		A small quantity of radioactive material can produce an enormous amount of energy.

questions.Question: Acid is an example of _____________
questions.solution: Solution:		Acids are substances that give up Hydrogen ions in solution. Acids are corrosive to metals while releasing Hydrogen gas, have a pH between 0 and 6.9 and are sour to the taste. There are many common substances that are acids: lemon juice (citric acid), vinegar (acetic acid), stomach acid, and soda pop (carbonic acid).

questions.Question: Symbiosis is shown by

questions.solution: Solution:		The formation of a climax community from an abandoned farm land is a an example of secondary succession.

questions.Question: Which of the following would be considered to be a biotic component of an environment?
questions.solution: Solution:		Biotic components are the living things that shape an ecosystem. Examples of biotic components include animals, plants, fungi, and bacteria. Abiotic components are non-living components that influence an ecosystem. Examples of abiotic factors are temperature, air currents, water, and minerals.

questions.Question: Bears are usually hunted and killed for their
questions.solution: Solution:		Bears are usually hunted and killed for their skin.

questions.Question: All the genes of a population is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The Collective Set of Alleles in a Population Is Its Gene Pool. The fact that genes exist in alternate forms, called alleles, forms the basis for the study of population genetics. Populations are made up of members of the same species that interbreed.

questions.Question: Viable material of endangered species can be preserved by
questions.solution: Solution:		Viable material of endangered species can be preserved by gene bank. Gene bank is an institute that maintains stocks of viable seeds (seed banks), live growing plants (orchards), tissue culture and frozen germplasm with the whole range of genetic variability.

questions.Question: Ecotype is a type of species in which environmentally induced variations are
questions.solution: Solution:		Ecotype is a type of species in which environmentally induced variations are genetically fixed.

questions.Question: Organisms having the potential for interbreeding and producing fertile offspring is called
questions.solution: Solution:		A species is a group of individual organisms that interbreed and produce fertile, viable offspring. questions.Question: _________ is a practice of clearing and burning the forest area for cultivation of crops for 3-4 years and shifting.

questions.Question: Growing agricultural crops between rows of planted trees is known as

questions.solution: Solution:		In India, the practice of clearing and burning the forest area for cultivation is known as jhum or jhoom. Slash-and-burn can be part of shifting cultivation, an agricultural system in which farmers routinely move from one cultivable area to another.

questions.Question: _____________ is the poisonous gas leaked during Bhopal gas tragedy

questions.solution: Solution:		If all the water vapour in the atmosphere were to condense and fall to the ground, the globe would be covered with about 1 inch of water.

questions.Question: The total mass of water vapour stored in the atmosphere at any moment is about ____ of the world's supply of precipitation.
questions.solution: Solution:		The total mass of water vapour stored in the atmosphere at any moment is about 1 week of the world's supply of precipitation.

questions.Question: The sun emits a maximum amount of radiation at wavelengths near ____, while the earth emits maximum radiation near wavelengths of ____.
questions.solution: Solution:		The sun emits a maximum amount of radiation at wavelengths near 0.5 micrometers, while the earth emits maximum radiation near wavelengths of 10 micrometers.

questions.Question: Trophic levels are formed by
questions.solution: Solution:		Trophic levels in a food chain are formed by producers, consumers and decomposers. In the given food chain, plants are producers. The animals eating plants are called as primary consumers and animals eating primary consumers are called as secondary consumers.

questions.Question: The drug morphine is extracted from _______ plant.
questions.solution: Solution:		The drug morphine is extracted from Opium Poppy plant.

questions.Question: Producers are otherwise known as
questions.solution: Solution:		Producers are organisms that make their own food; they are also known as autotrophs. They get energy from chemicals or the sun, and with the help of water, convert that energy into usable energy in the form of sugar, or food. The most common example of a producer are plants.

questions.Question: Decomposers are otherwise called as
questions.solution: Solution:		Decomposers are otherwise called as detritivores.

questions.Question: The pollution which does not persistent harm to life supporting system is
questions.solution: Solution:		The pollution which does not persistent harm to life supporting system is noise pollution.

questions.Question: A biomass pyramid is important because it illustrates
questions.optionA: How energy flows through a food web
questions.optionB: The number of species in each tropic level
questions.optionC: The biomass of all organisms at each tropic level in a system
questions.optionD: The number of tropic levels in a system
questions.solution: Solution:		Biomass pyramids show how much biomass (the amount of living or organic matter present in an organism) is present in the organisms at each trophic level, while productivity pyramids show the procreation or turnover in biomass.

questions.Question: Low clouds retard surface cooling at night better than clear skies because:
questions.optionA: The clouds absorb and radiate infrared energy back to earth
questions.optionB: The water droplets in the clouds reflect infrared energy back to earth
questions.optionC: The clouds start convection currents between them
questions.optionD: The clouds are better conductors of heat than is the clear night air E.  The formation of the clouds releases latent heat energy
questions.solution: Solution:		Low clouds retard surface cooling at night better than clear skies because the clouds absorb and radiate infrared energy back to earth.

questions.Question: The main reason(s) for warm summers in northern middle latitudes is that:
questions.optionA: The earth is closer to the sun in summer
questions.optionB: The sun is higher in the sky and we receive more direct solar radiation
questions.optionD: All of the above E.  Only (b) and (c) are correct
questions.solution: Solution:		The main reasons for warm summers in northern middle latitudes is that the sun is higher in the sky and we receive more direct solar radiation and the days are longer.

questions.Question: During an equinox:
questions.optionA: The days and nights are of equal length except at the poles
questions.optionB: At noon the sun is overhead at the equator
questions.optionC: The earth is not tilted toward nor away from the sun
questions.solution: Solution:		Although there’s nothing official about it, many say the March or vernal equinox signals the start of spring in the Northern Hemisphere and autumn in the Southern Hemisphere. The equinox is a hallmark of the seasons. At this equinox, the sun crosses the celestial equator, moving from south to north. The March 2020 equinox falls on March 20 at 03:50 UTC. That’s March 19 at 10:50 p.m. Central Daylight Time for us in North America; translate to your time zone.

questions.Question: All the statements are correct regarding ecological succession except
questions.optionB: Species diversity increases as succession proceeds
questions.optionC: The food chain relationships becomes more complex
questions.optionD: The role of decomposers becomes more and more important
questions.solution: Solution:		All the statements are correct regarding ecological succession except that it is a random process.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is the non-renewable resource?
questions.solution: Solution:		The most common examples of non-renewable resources are fossil fuels, such as coal, oil and natural gas. Although these resources form naturally within the earth, they take billions of years to do so. Other non-renewable resources include metals, minerals and stone.

questions.Question: The first tropic level refers to
questions.solution: Solution:		The first trophic level consists of primary producers such as plants and other photosynthetic organisms. The second trophic level consists of primary consumers that feed upon producers. They are herbivores.

questions.Question: Abyssal zone in ocean has
questions.optionA: no sunlight but contains decomposers and consumers
questions.solution: Solution:		Abyssal zone in ocean has no sunlight but contains decomposers and consumers.

questions.Question: Sunlight passes through a thicker portion of the atmosphere at
questions.optionD: Night E.  Both a and c
questions.solution: Solution:		Sunlight passes through a thicker portion of the atmosphere at sunrise and sunset.

questions.Question: A small particle of soil blown by dust is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		A small particle of soil blown by dust is known as suspension.

questions.Question: ________ is the natural phenomenon, caused by an unlimited and unprecedented rainfall.
questions.solution: Solution:		Floods is the natural phenomenon, caused by an unlimited and unprecedented rainfall.

questions.Question: _________ is an important factor that aggravates the effect of drought.
questions.solution: Solution:		Deforestation is an important factor that aggravates the effect of drought.

questions.Question: Which statement(s) below is/are correct?
questions.optionA: Valleys are more susceptible to radiation fog than hill tops
questions.optionB: Without the summer fog along the coast of California, redwoods would not grow well there
questions.optionC: Fog can be composed of ice crystals
questions.optionD: All of the above are correct
questions.solution: Solution:		All of the above are correct.

questions.Question: Which of the following statements is/are correct?
questions.optionA: The largest concentration of condensation nuclei are usually observed near the Earth
questions.optionB: Wet haze restricts visibility more than dry haze
questions.optionC: Fog is actually a cloud resting on the ground
questions.optionD: With the same water vapor content, fog that forms in dirty air is usually thicker than fog that forms in cleaner air E.  All of these are correct
questions.solution: Solution:		All of these are correct.

questions.Question: The pioneers in xerach succession is the
questions.solution: Solution:		The pioneer species in xerarch and hydrarch succession are lichens and phytoplanktons respectively. Xerarch is a plant succession starting on bare ground or rock and culminating in a mature climax forest. The pioneer species, such as lichens and mosses, result in the gradual accumulation of soil.

questions.Question: Which of the following processes acts to remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere?
questions.solution: Solution:		Photosynthesis removes CO2 from the atmosphere and replaces it with O2. Respiration takes O2 from the atmosphere and replaces it with CO2.

questions.Question: All food chains starts with  __________ and ends with decay.
questions.solution: Solution:		All food chains starts with photosynthesis and ends with decay.

questions.Question: The biosphere encompasses the total  __________ of living material in a region or the globe.
questions.solution: Solution:		The biosphere encompasses the total weight of living material in a region or the globe.

questions.Question: Meteorology is considered a branch of:
questions.solution: Solution:		Meteorology is a branch of the atmospheric sciences which includes atmospheric chemistry and atmospheric physics, with a major focus on weather forecasting. The study of meteorology dates back millennia, though significant progress in meteorology did not occur until the 18th century.

questions.Question: Study of inter-relationship between organisms and their environment is
questions.solution: Solution:		Ecology is the branch of biology, that deals with the inter-relationships amongst organism and interactions between organisms and their environment.

questions.Question: All oil traps contain
questions.solution: Solution:		All oil traps contain an impermeable layer.

questions.Question: The slow rate of decomposition of fallen logs in nature is due to their
questions.solution: Solution:		The microorganisms breakdown the complex compounds of dead protoplasm of producers and consumers absorb some of the decomposition products and release simple substances. The slow rate of decomposition of fallen logs in nature is due to their low moisture content The cellulose is in high amount in fallen logs.

questions.Question: A high Biological Oxygen Demand (BOD) indicates that:
questions.solution: Solution:		A high BOD indicates the presence of a large number of microorganisms, which suggests a high level of pollution.

questions.Question: Thorn-forests are found in the _______ regions.
questions.solution: Solution:		This type of vegetation is found in the north-western part of the country including semi-arid areas of Gujarat,Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Uttar Pradesh and Haryana. Acacias, palms, euphorbias and cacti are the main plant species.

questions.Question: Green plants are absent in deep sea. Why?
questions.solution: Solution:		Green plants are not found beyond a certain depth in the ocean because light can not penetrate deep into the ocean so, no producers are found in that zone as in the absence of sunlight green plants will not be able to produce food by photosynthesis.

questions.Question: Euro II standard refers to _________
questions.solution: Solution:		Euro II standard refers to lowering carbon content in fuel.

questions.Question: Boron, Zinc and Manganese are usually referred to as
questions.solution: Solution:		Zinc, Chlorine, Boron, Molybdenum, Copper, Iron, Manganese, Cobalt and Nickel are called micro-nutrients. They are called so because they are found and needed by plants in very small amount relative to other nutrients and are least likely to be limiting plant growth and healthy development.

questions.Question: _________ are used for converting saline or brackish water into pure distilled water.
questions.solution: Solution:		Distillation desalination is one of mankind's earliest forms of water treatment, and it is still a popular treatment solution throughout the world today. In ancient times, many civilizations used this process on their ships to convert sea water into drinking water.

questions.Question: The primary cause of a radiation inversion is:
questions.optionA: Infrared radiation emitted by the earth's surface
questions.optionB: Infrared radiation absorbed by the earth's surface
questions.optionC: Solar radiation absorbed by the earth's surface
questions.optionD: Solar radiation reflected by the earth's surface E.  Infrared radiation absorbed by the atmosphere and clouds
questions.solution: Solution:		A relatively cool layer of air, usually adjacent to a ground surface cooled by net loss of radiation, in which the air temperature increases with height.

questions.Question: Charged particles from the sun that travel through space at high speeds are called:
questions.solution: Solution:		The solar wind is a stream of charged particles released from the upper atmosphere of the Sun, called the corona.

questions.Question: All are particulate pollutants except
questions.solution: Solution:		Particulate matter consists of soot, flash, dust of various types, fur, hair, spores etc. They are classified into settleable and suspended particulate matter.

questions.Question: Water vapour is:
questions.solution: Solution:		Water vapour, water vapour or aqueous vapour is the gaseous phase of water. It is one state of water within the hydrosphere. Water vapour can be produced from the evaporation or boiling of liquid water or from the sublimation of ice. Unlike other forms of water, water vapour is invisible. Under typical atmospheric conditions, water vapour is continuously generated by evaporation and removed by condensation. It is less dense than air and triggers convection currents that can lead to clouds.

questions.Question: What is the cause of the Exxon Valdez?
questions.optionA: Oil Tanker which sank in 1989 along the coast of Alaska and marine life seriously affected.
questions.optionB: a plane which crashed and caused death of human life
questions.optionC: a ship which wrecked on the coast of India
questions.solution: Solution:		It spilled 10.8 million US gallons (260,000 bbl) (or 37,000 metric tonnes) of crude oil over the next few days. It is considered to be one of the worst human-caused environmental disasters. The Valdez spill is the second largest in US waters, after the 2010 Deep water Horizon oil spill, in terms of volume released

questions.Question: In calm air the air temperature is -10o C, if the wind speed should increase to 30 knots (with no change in air temperature) the thermometer would indicate:
questions.optionA: A much higher temperature than -10o C
questions.optionB: A much lower temperature than -10o C
questions.solution: Solution:		In calm air the air temperature is -10o C, if the wind speed should increase to 30 knots (with no change in air temperature) the thermometer would indicate a temperature of -10o C.

questions.Question: Infrared and visible satellite images might provide:
questions.optionA: A way of determining cloud thickness and altitude.
questions.optionB: A way of distinguishing between wet and dry clouds.
questions.optionC: A way of identifying clouds suitable for cloud seeding.
questions.optionD: A way of distinguishing between "new" and "old" clouds.
questions.solution: Solution:		Infrared satellite technology works by sensing the temperature of infrared radiation being emitted into space from the earth and its atmosphere. Basically, all objects (including water, land, and clouds), radiate infrared light. However, our eyes are not "tuned" to see this kind of light, so we don't notice it. Weather satellites not only sense this infrared light, but they can also sense the temperature of the infrared emissions. Visible satellite images can be thought of as photographs of the earth from space. Since they are like a photograph, they are dependent on visible light (brought by the sun). As a result, visible satellite pictures only work during daylight hours. This is the greatest drawback to using visible imagery. Also, since a visible satellite picture is basically a photograph, thicker clouds (which reflect the most sunlight) show up very bright, while thinner clouds (like cirrus) are hard to distinguish.

questions.Question: At what time of day is the relative humidity normally at a minimum?
questions.optionA: When the air temperature is highest
questions.optionD: When the air temperature is lowest
questions.solution: Solution:		Relative humidity is a measure of the water vapour content of the air at a given temperature. The amount of moisture in the air is compared with the maximum amount that the air could contain at the same temperature and expressed as a percentage.

questions.Question: The response of predator to prey and vice-versa, over ten of thousands of years, produces physical and behavioral changes in a process called
questions.solution: Solution:		The response of predator to prey and vice versa, over tens of thousands of years, produces physical and behavioral changes in a process known as coevolution. Coevolution can be mutually beneficial: many plants and pollinators have forms and behaviors that benefit each other.

questions.Question: The most important reason why summers in the Southern Hemisphere are not warmer than summers in the Northern Hemisphere is that:
questions.optionA: The earth is closer to the sun in January
questions.optionB: The earth is farther from the sun in July
questions.optionC: Over 80% of the Southern Hemisphere is covered with water
questions.optionD: The sun's energy is less intense in the Southern Hemisphere
questions.solution: Solution:		Over 80% of the Southern Hemisphere is covered with water.

questions.Question: The most important reason for decrease in biodiversity is
questions.solution: Solution:		The main cause of the loss of biodiversity can be attributed to the influence of human beings on the world’s ecosystem, In fact human beings have deeply altered the environment, and have modified the territory, exploiting the species directly, for example by fishing and hunting, changing the biogeochemical cycles and transferring species from one area to another of the planet.

questions.Question: Soil erosion can be prevented by
questions.solution: Solution:		Soil erosion can be prevented by afforestation.

questions.Question: ____________ is one of the most endangered species of Indian birds
questions.solution: Solution:		The Great Indian Bustard is a most endangered species of bird found only in India and adjoining region. Bustard is one of the largest flying species of bird with weight up to 15 kg and about 1 m tall from the ground.

questions.Question: The planet with a strong greenhouse effect, whose surface temperature averages 480oC (900oF) is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The planet with a strong greenhouse effect, whose surface temperature averages 480oC (900oF) is Venus.

questions.Question: Official date of Earth Day is on _________
questions.solution: Solution:		Official date of Earth Day is on April 22.

questions.Question: Name the disease caused by mercury poisoning in Japan
questions.solution: Solution:		Minamata disease, sometimes referred to as Chisso-Minamata disease, is a neurological syndrome caused by severe mercury poisoning. Symptoms include ataxia, numbness in the hands and feet, general muscle weakness, narrowing of the field of vision and damage to hearing and speech.

questions.Question: The Chipko movement is started by
questions.solution: Solution:		The Chipko movement is started by Sunderlal Bahuguna.

questions.Question: The change of state of ice into water vapour is known as:
questions.solution: Solution:		When ice turns directly into water vapor without first transitioning into a liquid, it is referred to as "sublimation." In fact, any solid that turns into a vapor without going through the liquid phase can be said to sublime or "sublimate."

questions.Question: Conservation within the natural habitat is
questions.solution: Solution:		Conservation within the natural habitat is insitu conservation.

questions.Question: Low level ozone is referred to as  __________ ozone.
questions.solution: Solution:		Low level ozone is referred to as tropospheric ozone.

questions.Question: The main atmospheric layer near the surface of earth is
questions.solution: Solution:		The atmosphere has 4 layers: the troposphere that we live in near the surface of the earth; the stratosphere that houses the ozone layer; the mesosphere, a colder and lower density layer with about 0.1% of the atmosphere; and the thermosphere, the top layer, where the air is hot but very thin.

questions.Question: Water used for paper mills should not contain
questions.solution: Solution:		Water used for paper mills should not contain iron.

questions.Question: Blue revolution is associated with
questions.solution: Solution:		The term "blue revolution" refers to the remarkable emergence of aquaculture as an important and highly productive agricultural activity. Aquaculture refers to all forms of active culturing of aquatic animals and plants, occurring in marine, brackish, or fresh waters.

questions.Question: A slow moving river of solid ice is called
questions.solution: Solution:		A glacier is a huge mass of ice that moves slowly over land. The term “glacier” comes from the French word glace (glah-SAY), which means ice. Glaciers are often called “rivers of ice.” Glaciers fall into two groups: alpine glaciers and ice sheets.

questions.Question: _________ is the phenomenon where the earth retains heat.
questions.solution: Solution:		The greenhouse effect is one of the main factors determining the temperature of a planet. It's the phenomenon by which certain gases – so-called greenhouse gases – in the atmosphere trap heat that would otherwise escape to space, thereby keeping the planet warm.

questions.Question: Ozone depletion in the stratosphere will cause
questions.solution: Solution:		Ozone depletion occurs when chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and halons—gases formerly found in aerosol spray cans and refrigerants—are released into the atmosphere. CFCs and halons cause chemical reactions that break down ozone molecules, reducing ozone's ultraviolet radiation-absorbing capacity.

questions.Question: Natural gas that was formed from ancient prehistoric forests is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Natural gas that was formed from ancient prehistoric forests is called Fossil fuels.

questions.Question: Pick out the world's rarest monkey.
questions.solution: Solution:		Golden langur is the world's rarest monkey.

questions.Question: The development of a bare area without any life form is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The development of a bare area without any life form is called Nudation.

questions.Question: _________ is a long term pattern of weather at a particular area.
questions.solution: Solution:		Climate is the long-term pattern of weather in a particular area. Weather can change from hour-to-hour, day-to-day, month-to-month or even year-to-year.

questions.Question: The lowest temperature is usually observed:
questions.optionD: Around sunrise E.  Several hours after sunrise
questions.solution: Solution:		The lowest temperature is usually observed around sunrise.

questions.Question: Species that occur in different geographical regions separated by special barrier are:
questions.solution: Solution:		Allopatric is the species that occur in different geographical regions separated by special barriers.

questions.Question: The crucial species that determine the ability of large number of other species is termed as _________ species.
questions.solution: Solution:		Within biological communities, some species may be important in determining the ability of large number of other species to persist in the community. It has a disproportionately large effect on its environment relative to its abundance. These crucial species are known as key stone species.

questions.Question: In the Northern Hemisphere, this day has the fewest hours of daylight:
questions.solution: Solution:		For people in the Northern Hemisphere, the December solstice marks the exact opposite, the day of the year with fewest hours of daylight. North of the Arctic Circle towards the North Pole there is no direct sunlight at all during this time of the year.

questions.Question: IUCN (The International Union For Conservation Of Nature And Natural Resources) headquarters is at
questions.solution: Solution:		Its headquarters are in Gland, Switzerland. IUCN has observer and consultative status at the United Nations and plays a role in the implementation of several international conventions on nature conservation and biodiversity.

questions.Question: The earth emits radiation with greatest intensity at:
questions.solution: Solution:		The earth emits radiation with the greatest intensity at: infrared wavelengths.

questions.Question: Slip erosion is also known as
questions.solution: Solution:		Slip erosion is also know as landslide. When earthquakes occur on areas with steep slopes, many times the soil slips causing landslides.

questions.Question: Some species of plants and animals are extremely rare and may occur only at a few locations are called
questions.solution: Solution:		Some species of plants and animals are extremely rare and may occur only at a few locations are called endangered.

questions.Question: Sulphur bacteria are examples of
questions.solution: Solution:		Sulphur bacteria are examples of autotrophs.

questions.Question: Autotrophs are ______________
questions.solution: Solution:		An autotroph or primary producer is an organism that produces complex organic compounds using carbon from simple substances such as carbon dioxide, generally using energy from light or inorganic chemical reactions.

questions.Question: North American grassland are called
questions.solution: Solution:		In North America temperate grasslands are called prairies.

questions.Question: African grasslands are called
questions.solution: Solution:		In South America, they're known as pampas. Central Eurasian grasslands are referred to as steppes, while African grasslands are savannas.

questions.Question: A Hawk that eats a frog is a
questions.solution: Solution:		A Hawk that eats a frog is tertiary consumer.

questions.Question: Abbreviation for NGO is
questions.solution: Solution:		NGO is an abbreviation for non-governmental organization.

questions.Question: What is the leading source of energy used in the United States today?
questions.solution: Solution:		Oil resources is the leading source of energy used in the United States today.

questions.Question: A human population is small, there is a greater chance of :
questions.solution: Solution:		A human population is small, there is a greater chance of genetic drift.

questions.Question: Which of the following is least likely to contain an oil trap?
questions.solution: Solution:		Syncline is least likely to contain an oil trap.

questions.Question: During the winter in the Northern Hemisphere, the "land of the midnight sun" would be found:
questions.optionD: In the desert southwest E.  On the West Coast
questions.solution: Solution:		During the winter in the Northern Hemisphere, the "land of the midnight sun" would be found: in high latitudes. During the winter solstice in the Northern Hemisphere, the day is less than 12 hours long and is increasing with each passing day.

questions.Question: Which of the following type of pollution can cause the outbreak of jaundice
questions.solution: Solution:		Water pollution can cause the outbreak of jaundice. Jaundice is caused by the organism Seriola quinqueradiata. The disease is characterised by yellow colorations of the skin, these yellow colourations are majorly due to the build-up of bilirubin in the blood.

questions.Question: India is primary centre of domestication of
questions.solution: Solution:		Vavilov centers are regions where a high genetic diversity can be found, representing the natural relatives of domesticated crop plants or animals. These areas are also called the primary areas of domestication. India is a primary center of domestication of Water Buffalo.

questions.Question: Which is an example for sedimentary biogeochemical cycle
questions.solution: Solution:		Sedimentary cycles include those of iron, calcium, phosphorus, sulfur, and other more-earthbound elements.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a reason why water warms and cools much more slowly than land?
questions.optionA: Solar energy penetrates more deeply into water
questions.optionB: Heat energy is mixed in a deeper layer of water
questions.optionC: Water has a higher heat capacity
questions.optionD: A portion of the solar energy that strikes water is used to evaporate it E.  It takes more heat to raise the temperature of a given amount of soil 1oC  than it does to raise the temperature of water 1oC
questions.solution: Solution:		Water warms and cools much more slowly than land because it takes more heat to raise the temperature of a given amount of soil 1oCthan it does to raise the temperature of water 1oC.

questions.Question: The gas that shows the most variation from place to place and from time to time in the lower atmosphere:
questions.solution: Solution:		The gas that shows the most variation from place to place and from time to time in the lower atmosphere Water vapour (H2O).

questions.Question: The ozone at ground level is primarily from  __________ precursors.
questions.solution: Solution:		The ozone at ground level is primarily from fossil fuel precursors.

questions.Question: Gas released during photosynthesis is
questions.solution: Solution:		Oxygen is released during the process of photosynthesis.

questions.Question: The earth's first atmosphere was composed primarily of:
questions.solution: Solution:		At its initial formation, the Earth's first atmosphere was composed primarily of the light elements hydrogen and helium.

questions.Question: Which gas is likely to be reduced in the atmosphere by deforestation?
questions.solution: Solution:		Oxygen is the gas which is likely to be reduced in the atmosphere by deforestation. One of the most dangerous threats to life on earth is the increase in pollution which is caused because of the increase in the concentration of carbon dioxide and carbon monoxide in the environment.

questions.Question: In a volume of air near the earth's surface, ____ occupies 78 percent and ____ nearly 21 percent.
questions.optionD: Nitrogen, water vapor E.  Hydrogen, helium
questions.solution: Solution:		In a volume of air near the earth's surface, nitrogen occupies 78 percent and oxygen nearly 21 percent.

questions.Question: The Anthrax disease is caused by
questions.solution: Solution:		Anthrax is a serious infectious disease caused by gram-positive, rod-shaped bacteria known as Bacillus anthracis. Anthrax can be found naturally in soil and commonly affects domestic and wild animals around the world.

questions.Question: Bio gas generation is mainly based on the principle of
questions.solution: Solution:		Biogas generation is mainly based on the principle of biodegradation. Biogas is a type of gas which is produced from the decomposition of any biodegradable waste by various bacteria. It results the formation of methane.

questions.Question: Which of the following ecological pyramid is always upright?
questions.solution: Solution:		Pyramid of energy, showing the rate of energy flow and/or productivity at successive trophic levels. The pyramids of numbers and biomass may be upright or inverted depending upon the nature of the food chain in the particular ecosystem, whereas pyramids of energy are always upright.

questions.Question: A graphic representation of number of individuals of different species belonging to each trophic level in a an ecosystem is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		This deals with the relationship between the numbers of primary producers and consumers of different levels. It is a graphical representation of the total number of individuals of different species, belonging to each trophic level in an ecosystem.

questions.Question: "Silent Spring" is a well known book written by
questions.solution: Solution:		Silent Spring is an environmental science book by Rachel Carson. The book was published on September 27, 1962, documenting the adverse environmental effects caused by the indiscriminate use of pesticides.

questions.Question: In an aquatic ecosystem, the tropic level equivalent to cows in grasslands is
questions.solution: Solution:		Zooplanktons are the microscopic animals that on the phytoplanktons in an aquatic ecosystem. These are truely herbivorous and Form the second trophic level (primary consumers) equivalent to cows in grasslands.

questions.Question: The order of succession in a hydrosere is
questions.optionA: Rooted aquatic plants-> phytoplankton->Free floating stage->Reed swamp stage->Sedge Meadow stage-> wood land stage-> Climax forest
questions.optionB: Rooted aquatic plants-> phytoplankton->Free floating stage-> Sedge Meadow stage-> Reed swamp stage-> wood land stage-> Climax forest
questions.optionC: phytoplankton->Rooted aquatic plants->Free floating stage->Reed swamp stage-> wood land stage-> Sedge Meadow stage-> Climax forest
questions.optionD: phytoplankton->Rooted aquatic plants->Free floating stage->Reed swamp stage->Sedge Meadow stage-> wood land stage-> Climax forest
questions.solution: Solution:		Phytoplankton->Rooted aquatic plants->Free floating stage->Reed swamp stage->Sedge Meadow stage-> Wood land stage-> Climax forest.

questions.Question: The species of plants that play a vital role in controlling the relative abundance of other species in a community are called
questions.solution: Solution:		A keystone species is a plant or animal that plays a unique and crucial role in the way an ecosystem functions.

questions.Question: The historical monument that is affected by acid rain is
questions.solution: Solution:		Monuments that have already been affected by acid rain include the Taj Mahal and the Lotus Temple.

questions.Question: Good urban planning is essential for  __________ land use.
questions.solution: Solution:		Good urban planning is essential for rational land use.

questions.Question: In which year Silent Valley was declared as National Park?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1983 the then Prime Minister of India, Indira Gandhi, decided to abandon the Project. In the year of 1984, it was declared as a National Park with the project area included. In 1986, the Silent Valley was declared the core area in the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve.

questions.Question: In which year was "Project Tiger" launched?
questions.solution: Solution:		One of the most intensive conservation efforts in India, Project Tiger was launched in 1973. It envisaged the setting up of tiger reserves to help in maintaining the population of tigers. As per estimates, the number of tigers was about 40,000 at the beginning of the 20th century.

questions.Question: World Forest day is celebrated on
questions.solution: Solution:		World Forest day is celebrated on 21st March.

questions.Question: The Indian Parliament passed the Biodiversity Bill in the year_________
questions.solution: Solution:		The Biological Diversity Act, 2002 is an Act of the Parliament of India for preservation of biological diversity in India, and provides mechanism for equitable sharing of benefits arising out of the use of traditional biological resources and knowledge.

questions.Question: Which year was declared as the "Water Year" by Indian government
questions.solution: Solution:		Year 2007 is Water Year declared by the government.

questions.Question: Pencillium does not swallow the growth of bacterium Staphylococcus. This sort of relationship is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Pencillium does not swallow the growth of bacterium Staphylococcus. This sort of relationship is called amensalism.

questions.Question: The Salim Ali Bird sanctuary is located at
questions.solution: Solution:		The Thattekkad Bird Sanctuary has a rich and varied birdlife. Several species of birds, both forest birds as well as the water birds, visit the sanctuaries

questions.Question: The instrument that measures temperature, pressure, and humidity at various altitudes in the atmosphere:
questions.solution: Solution:		The radiosonde is a balloon-borne instrument platform with radio transmitting capabilities. Originally named a radio-meteorograph, the instrument is now referred to as a radiosonde, a name apparently derived by H. Hergesell from a combination of the words "radio" for the onboard radio transmitter and "sonde", which is messenger from old English. The radiosonde contains instruments capable of making direct in-situ measurements of air temperature, humidity and pressure with height, typically to altitudes of approximately 30 km. These observed data are transmitted immediately to the ground station by a radio transmitter located within the instrument package.

questions.Question: The species that flower are called
questions.solution: Solution:		The angiosperms (also called flowering plants) are a major group of land plants, with 250,000 species having been described. Angiosperms comprise one of the two groups in the seed plants The flowering plants cover their seeds by including them in a true fruit. They bear the reproductive organs in a structure called a flower; the ovule is enclosed within a carpel (female reproductive organ of a flower), which will lead to a fruit.

questions.Question: Basidiospores are considered to be a major source of
questions.solution: Solution:		A basidiospore is a reproductive spore produced by Basidiomycete fungi, a grouping that includes mushrooms, shelf fungi, rusts, and smuts. Basidiospores typically each contain one haploid nucleus that is the product of meiosis, and they are produced by specialized fungal cells called basidia

questions.Question: The heat energy released when water vapour changes to a liquid is called:
questions.solution: Solution:		Latent heat of condensation, also called the heat of vaporization, is the amount of energy necessary to change a liquid to a vapour at constant temperature and pressure.

questions.Question: Molten rock deep inside the earth is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Below the crust lies a layer of very hot, almost solid rock called the mantle. Beneath the mantle lies the core. ... Sometimes, hot molten rock, called magma, bursts through Earth's surface in the form of a volcano.

questions.Question: Pangolins feed on
questions.solution: Solution:		The diet of pangolins is fairly simple and straightforward. They are carnivorous animals, usually consuming a wide variety of ant and termite species, but are also able to eat larvae and a few other insects.

questions.Question: Suppose saturated polar air has an air temperature and dew point of -10o C, and unsaturated desert air has an air temperature of 35o C and a dew point of 10o C. The desert air contains ______ water vapour and has a ________ relative humidity than the polar air.
questions.solution: Solution:		Suppose saturated polar air has an air temperature and dew point of -10o C, and unsaturated desert air has an air temperature of 35o C and a dew point of 10o C. The desert air contains more water vapour and has a relative humidity than the polar air.

questions.Question: Radiation can cause
questions.solution: Solution:		Radiation can cause leukemia.

questions.Question: What is meant by ex-situ conservation?
questions.optionA: Conservation of a species by protecting its habitat along with all other species living there
questions.optionC: Conservation of a species outside its natural habitat
questions.solution: Solution:		Conservation of a species outside its natural habitat.

questions.Question: Earth summit of Rio de Janeiro (1992) resulted in
questions.solution: Solution:		The Earth Summit of Rio de Janeiro, also known as the United Nations Conference on Environment and Development (UNCED), was held in Rio de Janeiro from 3 to 14 June 1992. It resulted in the Convention on Biodiversity, a multilateral treaty.

questions.Question: Photosynthesis is found in
questions.solution: Solution:		In plants, photosynthesis takes place in chloroplasts, which contain the chlorophyll. Chloroplasts are surrounded by a double membrane and contain a third inner membrane, called the thylakoid membrane, that forms long folds within the organelle.

questions.Question: Organisms which depend on Producers for nutrition are called
questions.solution: Solution:		Organisms are characterized into two broad categories based upon how they obtain their energy and nutrients: autotrophs and heterotrophs. Autotrophs are known as producers because they are able to make their own food from raw materials and energy. Examples include plants, algae, and some types of bacteria. Organisms which depend on Producers for nutrition are called heterotrophs or consumers.

questions.Question: Phytoplankton are
questions.solution: Solution:		Phytoplankton are producers of lakes.

questions.Question: Which of the following green house gases trap more heat?
questions.solution: Solution:		Trifluoro methyl sulphurpentafluoride trap more heat.

questions.Question: The most abundant gas in the stratosphere is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The atmosphere contains many gases, most in small amounts, including some pollutants and greenhouse gases. The most abundant gas in the atmosphere is nitrogen, with oxygen second. Argon, an inert gas, is the third most abundant gas in the atmosphere.

questions.Question: Acid rain mainly result from
questions.solution: Solution:		Acid rain is caused by emissions of sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxide, which react with the water molecules in the atmosphere to produce acids. ... Nitrogen oxides can also be produced naturally by lightning strikes, and sulfur dioxide is produced by volcanic eruptions.

questions.Question: Animals that feed only on plants are called
questions.solution: Solution:		Animals that eat only plants are called herbivores (or primary consumers). Animals that eat other animals are called carnivores.

questions.Question: The first trophic level in a food chain
questions.solution: Solution:		The first trophic level of the food chain is always occupied by green plants which are termed to be producers. This is because producers absorb sunlight, abiotic factor and fix it into food chain. This energy is transferred to organisms in other trophic levels of the food chain.

questions.Question: The dramatic increase in agricultural production that have been made possible by high yield miracle crops are called the
questions.solution: Solution:		The dramatic increase in agricultural production that have been made possible by high yield miracle crops are called the green revolution.

questions.Question: In the atmosphere, tiny solid or liquid suspended particles of various composition are called:
questions.solution: Solution:		Aerosols are tiny solid or liquid particles that are suspended in the air. Most aerosols are microscopic and too small to see individually without a microscope. Aerosols include things like dust, pollen, smoke, and even cloud droplets.

questions.Question: What is meant by GM foods?
questions.solution: Solution:		GM foods genetically modified food.

questions.Question: Which of the following gas is present at a very high concentration in our environment?
questions.solution: Solution:		N2 is present at a very high concentration in our environment.

questions.Question: _________ refers to the phenomenon in that the organisms are exclusively restricted to a given area.
questions.solution: Solution:		 Endemism refers to the phenomenon in that the organisms are exclusively restricted to a given area.

questions.Question: Largest reptile in the world
questions.solution: Solution:		Largest reptile in the world Anaconda.

questions.Question: The movement "Beej Bachao Andolan" was aimed for the conservation of _______
questions.solution: Solution:		The Beej Bachao Movement also known as the Beej Bachao Andolan or BBA was started in Jardhargaon in Tehri Garhwal to conserve and promote indigenous seeds and agricultural practices. It has its roots in the Chipko Movement.

questions.Question: A dim, "watery" sun visible through a gray sheet-like cloud layer is often a good indication of ____ clouds.
questions.solution: Solution:		A dim, "watery" sun visible through a gray sheet-like cloud layer is often a good indication of Altostratus clouds.

questions.Question: The source of energy in an ecosystem is
questions.solution: Solution:		The Sun is the major source of energy for organisms and the ecosystems of which they are a part. Producers such as plants, algae, and cyanobacteria use the energy from sunlight to make organic matter from carbon dioxide and water. This establishes the beginning of energy flow through almost all food webs.

questions.Question: Which one of the following problems is not created by noise pollution?
questions.solution: Solution:		Diarrhoea is not created by noise pollution.

questions.Question: An ideal shelter for housing a temperature-measurement instrument should be:
questions.optionD: Both white and in the shade E.  Both black and in the shade
questions.solution: Solution:		An ideal shelter for housing a temperature-measurement instrument should be both white and in the shade.

questions.Question: Air pollution is likely to be most severe
questions.optionB: near the center of an anticyclone
questions.solution: Solution:		Air pollution is likely to be most severe near the center of an anticyclone.

questions.Question: In meteorology, the word insolation refers to:
questions.solution: Solution:		The term insolation is derived from the words "incoming solar radiation". Insolation is specifically applied to radiation which is arriving at earth's atmosphere first and then earth surface.

questions.Question: In ecological succession from pioneer to climax community, the biomass shall
questions.solution: Solution:		When the community moved from a pioneer community to the climax community, the biomass will increase. This will increase the biomass because the number of organisms belonging to different species will also increase.

questions.Question: Suppose it is a winter night and at about 11 p.m., the air cools to the dew-point temperature and a thick radiation fog develops. If the air continues to cool during the night, in 5 hours the dew point temperature will probably:
questions.optionA: Decrease as the air becomes drier
questions.optionB: Decrease as the air becomes moister
questions.optionC: Increase as the air becomes drier
questions.optionD: Increase as the air becomes moister
questions.solution: Solution:		Decrease as the air becomes drier.

questions.Question: What is oil slick?
questions.optionC: Thin film of oil in sea water
questions.solution: Solution:		A film or layer of oil floating on an expanse of water.

questions.Question: India ranks  __________ amongst the wind-energy producing countries of the world.
questions.solution: Solution:		India in the third week of December 2016 was ranked 4th in the Global Wind Power Installed Capacity Index. The cumulative installed wind power generation capacity of India is 25088 MW. The cumulative installed wind power generation capacity of China is 145362 MW.

questions.Question: World wildlife week is observed during
questions.solution: Solution:		Wildlife week is celebrated all over the country in the month of October from 2nd to 8th every year with the view to preserve the fauna, i.e., the animal life of the India.

questions.Question: The concept that 'population tends to increase geometrically while food supply increases arithmetically' was put forward by
questions.solution: Solution:		The concept that 'population tends to increase geometrically while food supply increases arithmetically were put forward by Thomas Malthus. In his theory of natural selection, Charles Darwin was greatly influenced by the English clergyman Thomas Malthus.

questions.Question: About ____ of the meteorologists and atmospheric scientists in the United States work in the field of weather forecasting.
questions.solution: Solution:		About one-half of the meteorologists and atmospheric scientists in the United States work in the field of weather forecasting.

questions.Question: An important reason for the large daily temperature range over deserts is:
questions.optionA: There is little water vapor in the air to absorb and re-radiate infrared radiation
questions.optionB: The light-colored sand radiates heat very rapidly at night
questions.optionC: Dry air is a very poor heat conductor
questions.optionD: Free convection cells are unable to form above the hot desert ground E.  The ozone content of desert air is very low
questions.solution: Solution:		There is little water vapor in the air to absorb and re-radiate infrared radiation.

questions.Question: The formula of growth rate for population in given time is
questions.solution: Solution:		The formula of growth rate for population in given time is dN/dt=rN.

questions.Question: Air is composed of gases, water vapours and
questions.solution: Solution:		Air is composed of gases, water vapours and many of the dust particles.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a biodiversity hot spots in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		It hosts 4 biodiversity hotspots:the Himalayas, the Western Ghats, the Indo-Burma region and the Sundaland (Includes Nicobar group of Islands). These hotspots have numerous endemic species.

questions.Question: Temperate forests occur in India in
questions.solution: Solution:		In India, these forests are distributed between 1700-3000 meter altitude in the Himalayas.

questions.Question: _________ is a source of all minerals.
questions.solution: Solution:		Soil is a source of all minerals.

questions.Question: _________ energy is the energy stored within the earth.
questions.solution: Solution:		Thermal energy, or heat, is the energy that comes from the movement of atoms and molecules in a substance. Heat increases when these particles move faster. Geothermal energy is the thermal energy in the earth. Motion energy is energy stored in the movement of objects.

questions.Question: The largest brackish water lake situated in Asia is in Orissa. Which is the lake?
questions.solution: Solution:		Chilika, the largest brackish water lake in Asia. Its is home to many migratory birds in the winters.

questions.Question: IUCN is also called as
questions.solution: Solution:		It changed its name to the International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources (IUCN) in 1956 and was also known as the World Conservation Union (IUCN) from 1990 to 2008. The IUCN is the world's oldest global environmental organization. Its headquarters are in Gland, Switzerland.

questions.Question: 5th June is observed as
questions.solution: Solution:		World Environment Day is held each year on June 5. It is one of the principal vehicles through which the United Nations (UN) stimulates worldwide awareness of the environment and enhances political attention and action.

questions.Question: The average temperature of the earth is about  __________ degree F.
questions.solution: Solution:		GISS data show global average temperatures in 2017 rose 1.62 degrees Fahrenheit (0.9 degrees Celsius) above the 1951-1980 mean. According to GISS, the global mean surface air temperature for that period was estimated to be 57 F (14 C). That would put the planet's average surface temperature in 2017 at 58.62 F (14.9 C).

questions.Question: Hippocrates mentioned air pollution in  __________ BC.
questions.solution: Solution:		Hippocrates mentioned air pollution in 400 BC.

questions.Question: The first oil well was drilled in the United States in
questions.solution: Solution:		On August 27, 1859, George Bissell and Edwin L. Drake made the first successful use of a drilling rig on a well drilled especially to produce oil, at a site on Oil Creek near Titusville, Pennsylvania.

questions.Question: The first Environmental Law in India was enacted in
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: One atom of chlorine can destroy over  __________ molecules of ozone.
questions.solution: Solution:		One chlorine atom can destroy over 100,000 ozone molecules before it is removed from the stratosphere. Ozone can be destroyed more quickly than it is naturally created. methyl bromide A compound consisting of carbon, hydrogen, and bromine.

questions.Question: Which book written by Rachel Carson resulted in banning DDT in USA?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mocked for Being a 'Woman Studying Genetics,' How Rachel Carson Got DDT Banned. Considered one of Carson's most exceptional and groundbreaking books that marked a new public awareness about the use of chemical pesticides, especially DDT, Silent Spring was published on September 27, 1962.

questions.Question: Any unfavorable alteration of the environment may be called as
questions.solution: Solution:		Environmental pollution is the unfavorable alteration of our surroundings, wholly or largely as a byproduct of man's actions, through direct or indirect effects of the changes in the energy pattern, radiation levels, and chemical and physical constitution and abundance of organisms.

questions.Question: Energy resources derived from natural organic materials are called
questions.solution: Solution:		Energy resources derived from natural organic materials are called fossil fuels.

questions.Question: Total amount of living material at the various trophic levels of a food chain is depicted by pyramids of
questions.solution: Solution:		Pyramid of biomass is the graphical representation of total amount of living material at each trophic level of a food chain. Pyramid of numbers represent the number of individuals in each trophic level of a food chain. Pyramid of energy represents the amount of energy at each trophic level of a food chain.

questions.Question: Which group of vertebrates comprises the highest number of endangered species?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mammals have 177 endangered species among vertebrates which represents 3.8% of all the species.

questions.Question: Gharial is a
questions.solution: Solution:		The gharial (Gavialis gangeticus), also known as the gavial or the fish-eating crocodile, is a crocodilian in the family Gavialidae and among the longest of all living crocodilians.

questions.Question: At what time during a 24-hour day would a radiation temperature inversion best be developed?
questions.optionC: Toward the end of the morning
questions.optionD: Between 2 and 5 pm when the air temperature reaches a maximum
questions.solution: Solution:		Near sunrise a radiation temperature inversion best be developed.

questions.Question: Animal dung is  __________ waste.
questions.solution: Solution:		Animal dung is biodegradable waste. Animal dung contains hydrocarbons, which can be broken down into simpler organic molecules, such as methane, hydrogen, water and oxygen.

questions.Question: Normally rain water is slightly
questions.solution: Solution:		Normal" rainfall is slightly acidic because of the presence of dissolved carbonic acid.

questions.Question: _________ causes loss of water because of seepage of water into the soil.
questions.solution: Solution:		Percolation causes loss of water because of seepage of water into the soil.

questions.Question: In a pyramid of numbers, in a grassland ecosystem, the largest population is that of
questions.solution: Solution:		In a pyramid of numbers, in a grassland ecosystem, the largest population is that of producers.

questions.Question: Herbivores are also called as
questions.solution: Solution:		Herbivores are also known as plant eating animals or primary consumers.

questions.Question: The worst nuclear accident happened to date is occurred at
questions.solution: Solution:		The worst nuclear accident to date was the Chernobyl disaster which occurred in 1986 in Ukraine. The accident killed 31 people directly and damaged approximately $7 billion of property.

questions.Question: Energy of motion is also known as:
questions.optionD: Static energy E.  Latent heat energy
questions.solution: Solution:		Kinetic energy is the energy of motion. All moving objects have kinetic energy. When an object is in motion, it changes its position by moving in a direction: up, down, forward, or backward.

questions.Question: World Ozone day is
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1994, the United Nations General Assembly proclaimed 16 September the International Day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer, commemorating the date of the signing, in 1987, of the Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer.

questions.Question: The unit of total water content of the soil is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		Total water content available in a soil is called as holard. Soil water available to plants is called as chresard.

questions.Question: The unfavourable alteration of environment due to human activities is termed as
questions.solution: Solution:		Pollution is defined as the process of making land, water, air or other parts of the environment unfavorable for life by the introduction of a contaminant into a natural environment through human activities.

questions.Question: The complex network of interconnected food chains is called ___________
questions.solution: Solution:		A network of food chains existing together in an ecosystem is known as food web.

questions.Question: Autecology deals with
questions.solution: Solution:		Autecology is primarily experimental and deals with easily measured variables such as light, humidity, and available nutrients in an effort to understand the needs, life history, and behaviour of the organism or species.

questions.Question: Synecology deals with
questions.solution: Solution:		Synecology is a subfield of ecology concerned with the relations between groups of organisms or coexisting biological communities.

questions.Question: Ozone layer is present in
questions.solution: Solution:		The ozone layer is mainly found in the lower portion of the stratosphere, from approximately 15 to 35 kilometers (9.3 to 21.7 mi) above Earth, although its thickness varies seasonally and geographically. The ozone layer was discovered in 1913 by the French physicists Charles Fabry and Henri Buisson.

questions.Question: Ozone Umbrella is located in which layer of atmosphere
questions.solution: Solution:		The ozone layer is mainly found in the lower portion of the stratosphere, from approximately 15 to 35 kilometers (9.3 to 21.7 mi) above Earth, although its thickness varies seasonally and geographically.

questions.Question: One greenhouse gas contributes 14% to total global warming and another contributes 6%. These are respectively identified as
questions.optionD: Methane and CFCs E.  CFCs and CO2
questions.solution: Solution:		One greenhouse gas contributes 14% to total global warming and another contributes 6%. These are respectively identified as CFCs and N2O.

questions.Question: The cause of Bhopal disaster is
questions.solution: Solution:		The disaster happened because water entered a tank containing Methyl isocyanate. This caused a chemical reaction which resulted in the buildup of much Carbon dioxide, among other things.

questions.Question: At which city might you be able to observe cirrus clouds at an altitude of 3,000 m (10,000 feet) above the surface?
questions.solution: Solution:		At Barrow, Alaska one would be able to observe cirrus clouds at an altitude of 3,000 m (10,000 feet) above the surface.

questions.Question: Where are the days and nights of equal length all year long?
questions.solution: Solution:		At the Equator the days and nights are of equal length all year long

questions.Question: During the winter solstice in the Northern Hemisphere:
questions.optionA: Astronomical winter begins in the Northern Hemisphere
questions.optionB: The noon sun is overhead at 23.5o S latitude
questions.optionC: At middle latitudes in the Northern Hemisphere, this marks the longest night of the year
questions.solution: Solution:		The summer solstice (or estival solstice), also known as midsummer, occurs when one of the Earth's poles has its maximum tilt toward the Sun. It happens twice yearly, once in each hemisphere (Northern and Southern). For that hemisphere, the summer solstice is when the Sun reaches its highest position in the sky and is the day with the longest period of daylight. Within the Arctic circle (for the northern hemisphere) or Antarctic circle (for the southern hemisphere), there is continuous daylight around the summer solstice. On the summer solstice, Earth's maximum axial tilt toward the Sun is 23.44°. Likewise, the Sun's declination from the celestial equator is 23.44°.

questions.Question: The largest annual ranges of temperatures are found:
questions.optionC: At middle latitudes near large bodies of water
questions.optionD: At the Equator E.  In the Northern Central Plains of the United States
questions.solution: Solution:		The largest annual ranges of temperatures are found at polar latitudes over land.

questions.Question: Night time temperatures rarely drop below the dew point temperature because
questions.optionA: The dew will absorb all the heat
questions.optionB: Saturation vapor pressures always increase at night
questions.optionC: At saturation, latent heat of condensation is released into the air
questions.solution: Solution:		If the dewpoint happens to be much lower than the temperature, the air will cool off much more rapidly at night than if the dewpoint was closer to the temperature in the evening. This is why dry regions such as the high plains and desert regions have such large differences between the high and low temperature.Moist areas, such as regions near the coast tend to have a smaller spread between the high and low temperature. If the air has a high moisture content, some longwave radiation emitted by the earth's surface will be radiated back toward the surface.

questions.Question: The time of day when the relative humidity reaches a maximum value is usually
questions.optionA: At the time when the air temperature is highest
questions.optionB: In the middle of the afternoon
questions.optionC: At the time when the air temperature is lowest
questions.optionD: Just before sunrise E.  About midnight
questions.solution: Solution:		The relative humidity is usually highest around sunrise when the overnight low temperature is frequently close to the dew point. The humidity drops during the day as the temperature rises and usually reaches its lowest value in the middle or late afternoon when the day's maximum temperature is recorded

questions.Question: _________ power station at the mouth of the river blocks the flow of polluted water into the sea.
questions.solution: Solution:		Tidal power station at the mouth of the river blocks the flow of polluted water into the sea.

questions.Question: What is the animal symbol of W. W. F (World Wildlife Fund) ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Adored around the world, the distinctive black and white animal is a national treasure in China and has been the symbol of WWF since its formation in 1961. While its numbers are slowly increasing, the giant panda remains one of the rarest and most endangered bears in the world.

questions.Question: Minamata disease was caused by pollution of water by
questions.solution: Solution:		Minamata disease (M. d.) is methylmercury (MeHg) poisoning that occurred in humans who ingested fish and shellfish contaminated by MeHg discharged in waste water from a chemical plant.

questions.Question: What is "temporary threshold shift"?
questions.optionA: Hearing loss due to excessive noise
questions.solution: Solution:		A temporary threshold shift is a temporary shift in the auditory threshold. It may occur suddenly after exposure to a high level of noise, a situation in which most people experience reduced hearing. A temporary threshold shift results in temporary hearing loss.

questions.Question: In an average year, more people die from this than from any other natural disaster.
questions.optionD: Flash floods and flooding E.  Droughts
questions.solution: Solution:		In an average year, more people die from flash floods and flooding than from any other natural disaster.

questions.Question: What is deforestation?
questions.solution: Solution:		Deforestation, clearance, clearcutting or clearing is the removal of a forest or stand of trees from land which is then converted to a non-forest use. Deforestation can involve conversion of forest land to farms, ranches, or urban use. The most concentrated deforestation occurs in tropical rainforests.

questions.Question: Lions are found in
questions.solution: Solution:		Nearly all wild lions live in sub-Saharan Africa, but one small population of Asiatic lions exists in India's Gir Forest. Asiatic lions and African lions are subspecies of the same species. Asiatic lions once prowled from the Middle East to India.

questions.Question: Favorable morphological and physiological response to a change in environment is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Acclimatisation is the process in which an individual organism adjusts to a change in its environment (such as a change in altitude, temperature, humidity, photoperiod, or pH), allowing it to maintain performance across a range of environmental conditions. Hence, the correct answer is 'Acclimatisation'.

questions.Question: Which among the following is related to the word Mesoderm ?
questions.optionA: Anatomically advanced animals having all three germ layers
questions.optionB: No membrane-bound organelles, no peptidoglycan in cell walls, introns
questions.optionC: Forms blood and bone (leads to complex internal organs)
questions.solution: Solution:		Forms blood and bone (leads to complex internal organs).

questions.Question: Plantation produces around  __________ percentage of industrial woods.
questions.solution: Solution:		Plantation produces around forty percentage of industrial woods.

questions.Question: Upper layer of water in a single body of water is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		Upper layer of water in a single body of water is known as Epilimnion.

questions.Question: The lower limit of water availability in soil is known as
