questions.solution: Solution:		Rainfall that is acidic, possesses elevated H+ ion concentrations, and has been commonly known as ‘acid rain’. the contribution from SO2 is considerably smaller than during the 1970s, so that currently, oxidised and reduced nitrogen dominate acid deposition. Deposition of reduced nitrogen (N) compounds, e.g.NH4+, can acidify via microbial transformations in the soil and also assimilation in plants leading to acidification of the rhizospehere. Other compounds also contribute to acid deposition, e.g. hydrochloric acid (HCl)

questions.Question: Melanornia (skin cancer) is associated with
questions.solution: Solution:		Skin cancer is an abnormal growth of skin cells. It most often develops on areas of the skin exposed to the sun’s rays. Skin cancer affects people of all colors and races, although those with light skin who sunburn easily have a higher risk.

questions.Question: When oil and gas resources are burnt they kill many forests and lakes by
questions.solution: Solution:		The process that we call "burning" actually is chemical reactions with oxygen in the air. For the most part, the carbon combines with oxygen to form carbon dioxide (CO2), and the hydrogen combines with oxygen to form water vapor (H20). In both of these chemical reactions a substantial amount of energy is released as heat. Since heat is what is needed to instigate these chemical reactions, we have a chain reaction: reactions cause heat, which causes reactions, which cause heat, and so on. Once started the process continues until nearly all of the fuel has gone through the process (i.e., burned), or until something is done to stop it. Of course, the reason for arranging all this is to derive the heat.

questions.Question: Soil pollution is caused by
questions.solution: Solution:		soil pollution as part of land degradation is caused by the presence of xenobiotics (human-made) chemicals or other alteration in the natural soil environment.

questions.Question: What is hibernation and aestivation?
questions.optionC: adaptation of animals to escape from predators
questions.solution: Solution:		Aestivation is summer sleep and during aestivation, animals usually tend to rest in a shady and cool place. They take sleep during the hot hours of daytime.Hibernation is a winter sleep and in this sleep, an organism tend to pass the time in dormant conditions. They are not active at all. The find a warm place for themselves to protect their body from the surrounding cold environment.

questions.Question: One third of the global cases of Tuberculosis is in
questions.solution: Solution:		One third of the global cases of Tuberculosis is in India.

questions.Question: The biggest award for environmental activities in India is given in the name of an individual. In whose name is it constituted?
questions.solution: Solution:		The biggest award for environmental activities in India is given in the name of Indira Gandhi.

questions.Question: Water pollution is due to
questions.solution: Solution:		All of the above

questions.Question: Electromagnetic radiation with wavelengths between 0.4 and 0.7 micrometers is called:
questions.solution: Solution:		The higher the frequency, the shorter the wavelength. The only part of the spectrum that we can see is called visible. Wavelengths between 0.4 and 0.7 micrometers are visible. It appears white but contains different colors.

questions.Question: Which of the following has a wavelength shorter than that of violet light?
questions.solution: Solution:		Visible light is simply electromagnetic radiation in a range of wavelengths that our eyes are sensitive to. Visible wavelengths range from 0.0007 milimeters for red light, through orange, yellow, green, and blue, to 0.0004 milimeters for violet light. Ultraviolet is shorter wavelengths than violet.

questions.Question: This holds a planet's atmosphere close to its surface:
questions.solution: Solution:		Our atmosphere is a mixture of gases that surround Earth. It is kept in place by the pull of Earth's gravity. If Earth was a much smaller planet, like Mercury or Pluto, its gravity would be to weak to hold a large atmosphere.

questions.Question: During the afternoon the greatest temperature difference between the surface air and the air several meters above occurs on a:
questions.solution: Solution:		During the afternoon, the greatest temperature difference between the surface air and the air several meters above the ground occurs on a: clear, calm day.

questions.Question: Ideal conditions for a strong radiation inversion:
questions.optionD: Cloudy, windy, moist, summer night E.  Clear, windy, dry, summer night
questions.solution: Solution:		Ideal conditions for a strong radiation inversion: Clear, calm, dry, winter night.

questions.Question: Example of primary pollutant
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: In a photochemical smog, which gas is an eye and mucous membrane irritant?
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitrogen oxides are irritating to the eyes, skin, nose, mucous membranes and respiratory tract.

questions.Question: The temperature at which water boils depends mainly on:
questions.optionD: Air density E.  The specific heat of air
questions.solution: Solution:		The temperature at which water boils depends mainly on air pressure.

questions.Question: In a temperature inversion:
questions.optionA: Air temperature increases with increasing height
questions.optionB: Air temperature decreases with increasing height
questions.optionC: Air temperature remains constant with increasing height
questions.optionD: It is warmer at night than during the day
questions.solution: Solution:		Temperature inversion, a reversal of the normal behavior of temperature in the troposphere (the region of the atmosphere nearest the Earth's surface), in which a layer of cool air at the surface is overlain by a layer of warmer air. (Under normal conditions air temperature usually decreases with height.)

questions.Question: A term biotype means
questions.solution: Solution:		The organisms sharing a specified genotype also the genotype shared or its distinguishing peculiarity.

questions.Question: Fatal degenerative lung disease caused by particulate asbestos is referred to as
questions.solution: Solution:		Asbestosis is long term inflammation and scarring of the lungs due to asbestos fibres.

questions.Question: Radiations are harmful as it
questions.solution: Solution:		Radiation poisoning happens when a radioactive substance gives off particles that get into a person's body and cause harm. Different radioactive substances have different characteristics. They can harm and help people in different ways, and some are more dangerous than others.

questions.Question: Coral reefs in India can be seen in
questions.solution: Solution:		Coral reef in India found at Lakshadweep island,Gulf of Kutch,Gulf of Mannar and Andaman Islands, marine species and creatures like Dolphins, Sea-horse, Sea-cucumber, Sea-anemone,Dugong and sea turtle are the few wild animals of coral reefs found in India.

questions.Question: Minute particles and liquid droplets are collectively called
questions.solution: Solution:		Minute particles and liquid droplets collectively called aerosols also are suspended in the air.

questions.Question: Non-lonizing radiations with specific biological effects are
questions.solution: Solution:		In terms of potential biological effects, the non-ionizing portion of the spectrum can be subdivided into: The optical radiation portion, where electron excitation can occur (visible light, infrared light) The portion where the wavelength is smaller than the body. Heating via induced currents can occur.

questions.Question: The most harmful of ultraviolet radiation is
questions.solution: Solution:		UVB rays, which affect skin's top layer, cause skin cancer and most sunburns. Although UVA and UVB rays pose the greatest risk for sun damage, people who work with welding torches or mercury lamps may be exposed to UVC rays, the most dangerous type of UV radiation.

questions.Question: Many freshwater animals cannot live for long in sea water and vice versa mainly because of the
questions.optionB: Change in the levels of thermal tolerance
questions.optionD: Osmotic problems E.  Spectral quality of solar radiation
questions.solution: Solution:		In freshwater a fish is hypertonic to its environment, it means fish is saltier and water continuously moves into the fishes body via Osmosis. Hence Many freshwater animals cannot live for long in sea water and vice versa mainly because of Osmotic problems. So the correct answer is 'Osmotic problems'.

questions.Question: __________ is derived recently from living organisms and their metabolic products.
questions.solution: Solution:		Biofuel is derived recently from living organisms and their metabolic products.

questions.Question: According to the Stefan-Boltzmann law, the radiative energy emitted by one square meter of an object is equal to a constant multiplied by its temperature raised to the _______ power.
questions.solution: Solution:		According to the Stefan-Boltzmann law, the radiative energy emitted by one square meter of an object is equal to a constant multiplied by its temperature raised to the fourth power.

questions.Question: The nation whose government is promoting large families because of an aging population and low fertility rate is
questions.solution: Solution:		The nation whose government is promoting large families because of an aging population and low fertility rate is France.

questions.Question: _________ is the first country to have phased out the CFCs and HCFCs which are responsible for the depletion of the ozone layer.
questions.solution: Solution:		Germany is the first country to have phased out the CFCs and HCFCs which are responsible for the depletion of the ozone layer.

questions.Question: The pyramid of biomass is inverted in
questions.solution: Solution:		The pyramid of biomass is inverted in fresh water ecosystem.

questions.Question: Which one of the following cycle is not a gaseous biogeochemical cycle in ecosystem?
questions.solution: Solution:		Phosphorus cycle is a sedimentary biogeochemical cycle. It describes the lithosphere, hydrosphere and biosphere and the main reservoir pool is lithosphere.

questions.Question: All are primary pollutants except
questions.solution: Solution:		All are primary pollutants except Peroxyacetyl Nitrate (PAN).

questions.Question: Which one of the following is not a primary pollutant?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ozone is not a primary pollutant since it is formed by the photo-chemical reaction of oxygen with the UV rays and not directly discharged into the atmosphere by a source. Similarly, sulphuric acid is also not a primary pollutant.

questions.Question: Chipko movement is a public agitation that occurred in
questions.optionD: Tehri Garhwal area of Uttar Pradesh
questions.solution: Solution:		The Chipko movement or Chipko Andolan, was a forest conservation movement in India. It began in 1970s in Uttarakhand, then a part of Uttar Pradesh (at the foothills of Himalayas) and went on to become a rallying point for many future environmental movements all over the world.

questions.Question: Who coined the slogan of Chipko Movement "Ecology is Permanent economy".
questions.solution: Solution:		Bahuguna is also known for coining the Chipko slogan 'ecology is permanent economy'.

questions.Question: A river with high BOD value is
questions.solution: Solution:		The river which has high level of BOD is indicative of high pollution in the river as the dissolved oxygen available in the water is being used by the bacterias, and this result in less oxygen available to fish and other aquatic beings. Nitrates and phosphates contribute to high level of BOD.

questions.Question: The name given to a liquid drop of dew that freezes when the air temperature drops below freezing is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The name given to a liquid drop of dew that freezes when the air temperature drops below freezing is frozen dew.

questions.Question: "Ozone Hole" is a _____________
questions.solution: Solution:		The ozone hole is not technically a “hole” where no ozone is present, but is actually a region of exceptionally depleted ozone in the stratosphere over the Antarctic that happens at the beginning of Southern Hemisphere spring (August–October).

questions.Question: The maintenance of relatively constant internal environment is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The tendency to maintain a stable, relatively constant internal environment is called homeostasis.

questions.Question: The only ape found in India
questions.solution: Solution:		Hoolock Gibbon is the only Ape found in India, a primate species from the gibbon family of Hylobatidae. The Hoolock Gibbons of India are second largest of the gibbons, found only at south of Brahmaputra and east of the Dibang rivers in North East Indian states.

questions.Question: A smog that occurs due to low temperature and has reducing environment is
questions.solution: Solution:		Hence, the smog that occurs due to low temperature i.e. in cold climate, and has reducing environment is classical smog or London smog. So, the correct answer is 'London smog

questions.Question: The earth's radiation is often referred to as ________radiation, while the sun's radiation is often referred to as _________radiation.
questions.solution: Solution:		The earth's radiation is often referred to as longwave radiation, while the sun's radiation is often referred to as shortwave radiation.

questions.Question: Increased surface UV leads to increased  __________ ozone
questions.solution: Solution:		Increased surface UV leads to increased tropospheric ozone.

questions.Question: Photochemical smog is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Photochemical smog is called Los Angeles smog.

questions.Question: The albedo of the earth's surface is only about 4%, yet the combined albedo of the earth and the atmosphere is about 30%. Which set of conditions below best explains why this is so?
questions.optionA: High albedo of clouds, low albedo of water
questions.optionB: High albedo of clouds, high albedo of water
questions.optionC: Low albedo of clouds, low albedo of water
questions.optionD: Low albedo of clouds, high albedo of water
questions.solution: Solution:		High albedo of clouds, low albedo of water is the set of conditions below best explains why this is so.

questions.Question: World's most problematic aquatic weed is
questions.solution: Solution:		World's most problematic aquatic weed is eichornia.

questions.Question: _________ energy is the main driving force of the ecological system.
questions.solution: Solution:		The driving force for an ecosystem is solar energy. Plants use solar energy to synthesize their food by the process of photosynthesis. From solar energy, the energy is transferred to plants and other organisms via plants. Thus, the correct answer is 'Solar energy'.

questions.Question: Torrey Canyon is famous for
questions.solution: Solution:		SS Torrey Canyon was an LR2 Suezmax class oil tanker with a cargo capacity of 120,000 short tons (110,000 t) of crude oil. She was shipwrecked off the western coast of Cornwall, England, on 18 March 1967, causing an environmental disaster. At that time she was the largest vessel ever to be wrecked.

questions.Question: Most of the natural gas used in the United States is consumed by
questions.solution: Solution:		In the United States, most natural gas is burned as a fuel. In 2012 about 30% of the energy consumed across the nation was obtained from natural gas. It was used to generate electricity, heat buildings, fuel vehicles, heat water, bake foods, power industrial furnaces, and even run air conditioners!

questions.Question: Eravikulam National Park conserves
questions.solution: Solution:		It came under the control of Kerala government with regards to Resumption of Lands act of 1971. The reserve was named as Eravikulam Rajamalai wildlife sanctuary in 1975 to conserve Nilgiri tahr, which is endangered. It became a national park in 1978.

questions.Question: Zoos are examples for
questions.solution: Solution:		Zoos are examples for ex-situ conservation.

questions.Question: Red sea is an example of a ________  structure.
questions.solution: Solution:		Red sea is an example of a faulted structure.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not an indicative biological trait for the trait of ecology?
questions.solution: Solution:		Fish reproductive strategy is not an indicative biological trait for the trait of ecology.

questions.Question: When is the World Wildlife week ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Wildlife week is celebrated all over the country in the month of October from 2nd to 8th every year with the view to preserve the fauna, i.e., the animal life of the India.

questions.Question: Green revolution is associated with _________
questions.solution: Solution:		The Green Revolution in India refers to a period of time when agriculture in India changed to an industrial system due to the adoption of modern methods and technology such as high yielding variety (HYV) seeds, tractors, pump sets, etc. Green revolution was started by Dr. M.S. Swaminathan.

questions.Question: MAB program stands for
questions.solution: Solution:		Man and the Biosphere Programme (MAB) is an intergovernmental scientific programme, launched in 1971 by UNESCO, that aims to establish a scientific basis for the improvement of relationships between people and their environments.

questions.Question: MAB stands for
questions.solution: Solution:		Man and the Biosphere Programme (MAB) is an intergovernmental scientific programme, launched in 1971 by UNESCO, that aims to establish a scientific basis for the improvement of relationships between people and their environments.

questions.Question: Vermi-composting is a natural method of
questions.solution: Solution:		Vermicompost (vermi-compost, vermiculture) is the product of the decomposition process using various species of worms, usually red wigglers, white worms, and other earthworms, to create a mixture of decomposing vegetable or food waste, bedding materials, and vermicast.

questions.Question: Plants that grow in saline water-logged habitat are called
questions.solution: Solution:		A halophyte is a plant, that grows in waters of high salinity, coming into contact with saline water through its roots or by salt spray, such as in saline semi-deserts, mangrove swamps, marshes and sloughs, and seashores.

questions.Question: National Maritime Day of India is celebrated on ______________
questions.solution: Solution:		The National Maritime Day is celebrated every year on April 05 to illustrate the awareness in supporting intercontinental commerce and the global economy as the most well-organized, safe and sound, environmentally responsive approach of transporting goods from one corner to another corner of the world.
